newsitem.title: USA: Computer Associates shares bounce on deals.
newsitem.headline: Computer Associates shares bounce on deals.

text.p: Computer Associates International Inc shares jumped higher on Tuesday in reaction to a series of partnerships made with major hardware vendors and a related pact with Sun Microsystems Inc, analysts said.
Shares of the Islandia, New York-based company climbed 4-3/8 to 64-3/8 in early afternoon trading.

Andrew Roskill, an analyst at Smith Barney, said the company's plan to bundle a stripped-down version of its Unicenter TNG software with the offerings of a group of hardware vendors was a smart sales strategy.
"I think the Unicenter TNG (announcement) is a pretty new and significant event. They are announcing a partenership with am impressive list of OEM hardware partners," he said.

At the CA World conference in New Orleans, Computer Associates said vendors such as Hewlett-Packard Co, Digital Equipment Corp and Tandem Computers Inc, among others, will bundle a version of Unicenter TNG enterprise management software into their hardware.

Unicenter TNG is designed to help centrally manage, monitor and control all the information technology resources located worldwide in an organization, from desktop computers to the mainframe, from local area networks to the Internet.
"It really positions Computer Associates as the Switzerland of hardware vendors, meaning they are neutral and they work with all the vendors," Roskill said.
In return, Computer Associates could expose a new group of potential customers to its products.
Separately, the company said it would accelerate the adoption of Sun's Java with Unicenter TNG in a broad partnership to offer a Java-based version of Unicenter TNG.
